result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shasta Casey Howell in court.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson in court for Shasta Casey Howell. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Defense argues for bond modification, State objects with argument. Court modifies bond amount to $250 with same conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victims FM and DB, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
